benchmark_details.name: TrendFact (Hotspot Perception Fact-Checking Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: TrendFact is the first hotspot perception fact-checking benchmark that comprehensively evaluates fact verification, evidence retrieval, and explanation generation tasks. It includes 7,643 curated samples and an evidence library consisting of 66,217 entries.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary goal of TrendFact is to evaluate fact-checking systemsâ€™ performance in terms of explanation generation capabilities and their ability to perceive hotspot events.

data.source: Collected from trending platforms such as Weibo, Baidu, DouYin and existing datasets like CHEF.
data.annotation: Data was annotated manually by a team of graduate students.

methodology.calculation: Performance metrics are calculated based on responses to fact-checking tasks using predefined systems and metrics.
methodology.interpretation: Good performance is indicated by high accuracy and consistency scores on the explanation tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Fact-checking model performance showed that even advanced systems struggle to achieve high accuracy, indicating the challenge presented by TrendFact.
methodology.validation: TrendFact was validated through extensive experiments against various LLMs and RLMs.
